title: Gibraltar Point Walking Route

images.title: Kate Jewell / Gibraltar Point
images.caption: Looking across the salt marsh towards the Wash along Wainfleet Haven, also known as the Steeping River. The Norfolk coast can just be made out on the horizon.

images.title: Alan Heardman / Gibraltar Point
images.caption: Looking back from the Wash Viewpoint (Lil's Hut),towards the Visitor Centre.

images.title: Kate Jewell / Gibraltar Point
images.caption: Looking across the New Salt Marsh from the view point on the East Dunes.

images.title: Alan Heardman / Gibraltar Point
images.caption: View of an inland part of the Nature Reserve as seen from Mill Hill.

images.title: AlastairG / Tennyson's Sands Gibraltar Point
images.caption: Tennyson's Sands. As the tide comes in, more of the meadow becomes flooded.

images.title: AlastairG / Gibraltar Point National Nature Reserve
images.caption: This view from Mill Hill shows the Fenland lagoon with old saltmarsh to the left. The smoke is from the burning of brushwood. The bushes are a mixture of hawthorn, sea buckthorn, blackthorn and others. Brambles and hops are amongst the trailing plants growing through the bushes.

images.title: Looking northwards along the shoreline, Gibraltar Point by Christopher Hilton, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Gibraltar Point beach. Looking northwards along the shoreline.

images.title: Small pond at Gibraltar Point by Oliver Dixon, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Small pond

description: Enjoy a walk around this beautiful coastal national nature reserve near Skegness. It's a lovely place for a peaceful stroll with numerous footpaths to follow through the sand, saltmarsh and dunes with several artificial lakes and bird hides along the way. There are lovely views of the Wash and the Lincolnshire coast and countryside. It's fantastic for bird watching with a variety of coastal birds to look out for. These include brent geese, shorelark, redwing and fieldfare. There's also an excellent visitor centre with a Wild Coast Exhibition that includes 3d models of sand dunes and salt marshes. The reserve is located just a few miles south of Skegness so you could easily walk there from the town. Parking is available at the reserve too though.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: There is an on site cafe located in the visitor centre. They sell a good range of meals and snacks.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: Please keep dogs on a short lead due to the wildlife and grazing livestock. Dogs are not permitted on the beach or foreshore between 1 April to 1 September.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: To continue your walking in the area head north and try our Skegness Walk. This takes you along the seafront, around the pretty boating lake and along the Lagoon Walk.

display_address: Gibraltar Road, Wainfleet St Mary, East Lindsey, Lincolnshire, England, PE24 4SU, United Kingdom
